meanings.definition: Adjust or fine-tune (something) to improve its performance or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours tweaking the settings on her computer to make it faster.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys tweaking his bike to make it ride smoother.
meanings.sent3: While tweaking the recipe, she accidentally added too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic was tweaking the engine like a musician tuning a guitar.
meanings.sent5: Tweaking the design of the building transformed it into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Make minor changes or improvements to (something).
meanings.sent1: The artist was tweaking the colors in the painting to make it more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: He kept tweaking the presentation until it was just right.
meanings.sent3: She was tweaking the essay, trying to find the perfect conclusion.
meanings.sent4: The chef was tweaking the recipe like a scientist in a lab.
meanings.sent5: Tweaking the garden layout made it more visually appealing.

meanings.definition: To fiddle with or play around with something in a casual or experimental manner.
meanings.sent1: He was tweaking the new gadget, trying to figure out all its features.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys tweaking different hairstyles to see what suits her best.
meanings.sent3: While tweaking the toy, he accidentally broke it.
meanings.sent4: The child was tweaking the toy car as if it were a real vehicle.
meanings.sent5: Tweaking the radio dial, she finally found her favorite station.
